item.description: We will continue our discussion of "The Basic Teachings of the Buddha" by Glenn Wallis, published in 2007 by Random House. It is available in paperback. This book has received positive reviews as being an excellent introductory guide to Buddhist thought, applying its principles to everyday life, and gaining deeper understanding of Buddhist themes in modern literature. The author selected and translated sixteen essential dialogues drawn from some of the Buddha's lectures to his original students. In addition to his fresh translations of the teachings, the author's includes his own illuminating analysis of the teachings that show how they address modern psychological, religious, ethical, and philosophical concerns. Glenn Walllis, Ph.D., is an associate profesor of religion at the University of Georgia.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for a small sign on a cafe table saying "Book Discussion"
